quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Fate leads the willing and drags along the reluctant.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: We give up leisure in order that we may have leisure, just as we go to war in order that we may have peace.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Learning is not child's play. We cannot learn without pain.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Suffering becomes beautiful when anyone bears great calamities with cheerfulness, not through insensibility, but through greatness of mind.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Man is a goal-seeking animal. His life only has meaning if he is reaching out and striving for his goals.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: First, have a definite, clear, practical idea, a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends, wisdom, money, materials, and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: It represents the wise choice of many alternatives. Choice, not chance, determines your destiny.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Anybody can become angry, that is easy. But to be angry with the right person, and to the right degree, and at the right time, and for the right purpose, and in the right way, that is not within everybody's power, and is not easy.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: If one way be better than another, you may be sure it is nature's way.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Wicked men obey from fear, good men from love.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Look well into thyself. There is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess, and then thankfully remember how you would crave them if they were not yours.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Here is a rule to remember in future when anything tempts you to feel bitter. Not this is misfortune, but to bear this worthily is good fortune.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You don't have to turn this into something. It doesn't have to upset you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To live a good life, we all have the potential for it if we learn to be indifferent to what makes no difference.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what's left and live it properly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Your mind will take the shape of what you frequently hold in thought, for the human spirit is coloured by such impressions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is nature's delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A man's true delight is to do the things he was made for.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present without anxious dependence upon the future. Not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears, but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare. It is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We all sorely complain of the shortness of time, and yet have much more than we know what to do with.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Our lives are either spent in doing nothing at all, or in doing nothing to the purpose, or in doing nothing that we ought to do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Every night, before going to sleep, we must ask ourselves, what weakness did I overcome today? What virtue did I acquire?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Throw me to the wolves, and I will return leading the pack.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Life is never incomplete, if it is an honourable one. At whatever point you leave life, if you leave it in the right way, it is whole.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You want to live, but do you know how to live? You are scared of dying, but tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different to being dead?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The greatest blessings of mankind are within us, and within our reach.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A wise man is contented with his lot, whatever it may be.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man is affected, not by events, but by the view he takes of them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: As is a tale, so is life. Not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Sometimes, even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you are needing is not to be in a different place, but to be a different person.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Until we have begun to go without them, we fail to realise how unnecessary many things are.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms, you will be able to use them better when you are older.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more that is poor.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favourable.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: From this instant on, vow to stop disappointing yourself. Separate yourself from the mob, decide to be extraordinary, and do what you need to do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Now, what ought one to say then as each hardship comes? I was practising for this, I was training for this.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Fortify yourself with moderation, for this is an impenetrable fortress.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No great thing is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig, I will answer that there must be time. Let it first blossom, then bear fruit, then ripen.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The trials you encounter will introduce you to your strengths. Remain steadfast, and one day you will build something that endures. Something worthy of your potential.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The world turns aside to let any man pass, who knows where he is going.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do. Hold to your true aspirations, no matter what is going on around you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You may fetter my leg, but Zeus himself cannot get the better of my free will.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Seek not the good in external things, seek it in yourselves.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: On the occasion of every accident that befalls you, remember to turn to yourself, and enquire what power you have for turning it to use.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Caretake this moment. Immerse yourself in its particulars. Respond to this person, this challenge, this deed. Quit evasions. Stop giving yourself needless trouble. It is time to really live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you want to be a writer, write.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you. Whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be discriminating about what images and ideas you permit into your mind.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you, but answer. He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is impossible to begin to learn that which one thinks one already knows.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and all will be well with you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Never depend on the admiration of others. There is no strength in it. Personal merit cannot be derived from an external source.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Begin. To begin is half the work. Let half still remain. Again, begin this, and thou wilt have finished.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nothing happens to any man that is not formed by nature to bear.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Perfection of character is this. To live each day as if it were your last. Without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Treat whatever happens as wholly natural, not novel or hard to deal with, but familiar and easily handled.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Keep at it, as a blazing fire takes whatever you throw on it and makes it light and flame.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How long will you wait before you demand the best of yourself and trust reason to determine what is best?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A man, when he has done a good act, does not call out for others to come and see. But he goes on to another act, as a vine goes on to again produce the grapes in season.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It never ceases to amaze me. We all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinions than our own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Because your own strength is unequal to the task, do not assume that it is beyond the powers of man. But if anything is within the powers and province of man, believe that it is within your own compass also.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Confine yourself to the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be tolerant of others and straight with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Pleasures, when they go beyond a certain limit, are but punishments.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A setback has often cleared the way for greater prosperity. Many things have fallen, only to rise to more exalted heights.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The true man is revealed in difficult times.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: So, when trouble comes, think of yourself as a wrestler who God, like a trainer, has paired with a tough young buck. For what purpose? To turn you into Olympic class material. But this is going to take some sweat to accomplish.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: For God's sake, stop honouring externals. Quit turning yourself into the tool of mere matter, or of people who could supply you or deny you those material things.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not act as if you had 10,000 years to throw away. Death stands at your elbow. Be good for something while you live, and it is in your power.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A man must stand erect, not be kept erect by others.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars and see yourself running with them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Concentrate on what you have to do. Fix your eyes on it. Remind yourself that your task is to be a good human being.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Remind yourself what nature demands of people. Then do it, without hesitation, and speak the truth as you see it. But with kindness, with humility, without hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Strong minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Weak minds discuss people.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Remember that there is nothing stable in human affairs. Therefore, avoid undue elation in prosperity or undue depression in adversity.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Envy is the ulcer of the soul.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions, but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: By all means, marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy. If you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Mankind is made of two kinds of people. Wise people who know they are fools, and fools who think they are wise.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: I would rather die having spoken after my manner than speak in your manner and live.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: If all misfortunes were laid in one common heap, whence everyone must take an equal portion, most people would be contented to take their own and depart.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Be kind. For everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Regard your good name as the richest jewel you can possibly be possessed of. For credit is like fire, when once you have kindled it, you may easily preserve it. But if you once extinguish it, you will find it an arduous task to rekindle it again.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: I know you won't believe me, but the highest form of human excellence is to question oneself and others.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Get not your friends by bare compliments, but by giving them sensible tokens of your love.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future too.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be content with what you are, and wish not change; nor dread your last day, nor long for it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What we do now ripples into eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not waste the remainder of your life in thoughts about others.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Don't demand that things happen as you wish, but wish that they happen as they do happen, and you will go on well.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It is not events that disturb people, it is their judgments concerning them.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of one's desires, but by the removal of desire.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It is difficulties that show what men are.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste much of it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Life, if well lived, is long enough.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Wealth is the slave of a wise man and the master of a fool.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is quality rather than quantity that matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The more you know, the more you realize you don't know.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Hope is a waking dream.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Be as you wish to seem.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Prefer knowledge to wealth, for the one is transitory, the other perpetual.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when you are in, continue firm and constant.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Character is destiny.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Big results require big ambitions.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Happiness is a good flow of life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The wise man will live as long as he ought, not as long as he can.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best ideas are common property.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest wealth is a poverty of desires.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you're needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The mind is never right but when it is at peace within itself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The wise man will live as long as he ought, not as long as he can.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best ideas are common property.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest wealth is a poverty of desires.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you're needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The mind is never right but when it is at peace within itself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The wise man will live as long as he ought, not as long as he can.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The best ideas are common property.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greatest wealth is a poverty of desires.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you're needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The mind is never right but when it is at peace within itself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The obstacle is the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Fate leads the willing and drags along the reluctant.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Stand out of my sunlight.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.quote: I am looking for an honest man.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.quote: He has the most who is most content with the least.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.quote: Pleasure is the beginning and the goal of living blessedly.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us as the confident knowledge that they will help us.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: The misfortune of the wise is better than the prosperity of the fool.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: All things are numbers.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: Above all things, reverence yourself.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: The oldest, shortest words - 'yes' and 'no' - are those which require the most thought.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: Silence is better than unmeaning words.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: Friends are as companions on a journey, who ought to aid each other to persevere in the road to a happier life.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself.
quotes.author: Thales

quotes.quote: The most universal thing is hope, for hope stays with those who have nothing else.
quotes.author: Thales

quotes.quote: Water is the first principle of all things.
quotes.author: Thales

quotes.author: Thales

quotes.quote: The most universal thing is hope, for hope stays with those who have nothing else.
quotes.author: Thales

quotes.quote: Water is the first principle of all things.
quotes.author: Thales

quotes.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Be as you wish to seem.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Prefer knowledge to wealth, for the one is transitory, the other perpetual.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when you are in, continue firm and constant.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Character is destiny.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Big results require big ambitions.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Happiness is a good flow of life.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
quotes.author: Plato
